info.title: Google Partners API
info.description: Lets advertisers search certified companies and create contact leads with them, and also audits the usage of clients.

post.description: Logs a generic message from the client, such as `Failed to render component`, `Profile page is running slow`, `More than 500 users have accessed this result.`, etc.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.locale
parameters.description: Locale to use for the current request.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.partnersSessionId
parameters.description: Google Partners session ID.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.experimentIds
parameters.description: Experiment IDs the current request belongs to.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The ID of the company to retrieve.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.locale
parameters.description: Locale to use for the current request.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.partnersSessionId
parameters.description: Google Partners session ID.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.experimentIds
parameters.description: Experiment IDs the current request belongs to.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: The view of `Company` resource to be returned. This must not be `COMPANY_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED`.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: How to order addresses within the returned company. Currently, only `address` and `address desc` is supported which will sorted by closest to farthest in distance from given address and farthest to closest distance from given address respectively.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: If the company's budget is in a different currency code than this one, then the converted budget is converted to this currency code.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to use for sorting the company's addresses by proximity. If not given, the geo-located address of the request is used. Used when order_by is set.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.locale
parameters.description: Locale to use for the current request.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.partnersSessionId
parameters.description: Google Partners session ID.

parameters.name: requestMetadata.experimentIds
parameters.description: Experiment IDs the current request belongs to.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Requested page size. Server may return fewer companies than requested. If unspecified, server picks an appropriate default.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: A token identifying a page of results that the server returns. Typically, this is the value of `ListCompaniesResponse.next_page_token` returned from the previous call to [ListCompanies][google.partners.v2.Partner.ListCompanies].

parameters.name: companyName
parameters.description: Company name to search for.

parameters.name: view
parameters.description: The view of the `Company` resource to be returned. This must not be `COMPANY_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED`.

parameters.name: minMonthlyBudget.currencyCode
parameters.description: The 3-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

parameters.name: minMonthlyBudget.units
parameters.description: The whole units of the amount. For example if `currencyCode` is `"USD"`, then 1 unit is one US dollar.

parameters.name: minMonthlyBudget.nanos
parameters.description: Number of nano (10^-9) units of the amount. The value must be between -999,999,999 and +999,999,999 inclusive. If `units` is positive, `nanos` must be positive or zero. If `units` is zero, `nanos` can be positive, zero, or negative. If `units` is negative, `nanos` must be negative or zero. For example $-1.75 is represented as `units`=-1 and `nanos`=-750,000,000.

parameters.name: maxMonthlyBudget.currencyCode
parameters.description: The 3-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

parameters.name: maxMonthlyBudget.units
parameters.description: The whole units of the amount. For example if `currencyCode` is `"USD"`, then 1 unit is one US dollar.

parameters.name: maxMonthlyBudget.nanos
parameters.description: Number of nano (10^-9) units of the amount. The value must be between -999,999,999 and +999,999,999 inclusive. If `units` is positive, `nanos` must be positive or zero. If `units` is zero, `nanos` can be positive, zero, or negative. If `units` is negative, `nanos` must be negative or zero. For example $-1.75 is represented as `units`=-1 and `nanos`=-750,000,000.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: List of industries the company can help with.

parameters.name: services
parameters.description: List of services the company can help with.

parameters.name: languageCodes
parameters.description: List of language codes that company can support. Only primary language subtags are accepted as defined by BCP 47 (IETF BCP 47, "Tags for Identifying Languages").

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address to use when searching for companies. If not given, the geo-located address of the request is used.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: How to order addresses within the returned companies. Currently, only `address` and `address desc` is supported which will sorted by closest to farthest in distance from given address and farthest to closest distance from given address respectively.

parameters.name: gpsMotivations
parameters.description: List of reasons for using Google Partner Search to get companies.

parameters.name: websiteUrl
parameters.description: Website URL that will help to find a better matched company. .

post.description: Creates an advertiser lead for the given company ID.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The ID of the company to contact.

eventCategory.description: The category the action belongs to.

eventDatas.description: List of event data for the event.

url.description: The URL where the event occurred.

RequestMetadata.description: Common data that is in each API request.

locale.description: Locale to use for the current request.

experimentIds.description: Experiment IDs the current request belongs to.

EventData.description: Key value data pair for an event.

Lead.description: A lead resource that represents an advertiser contact for a `Company`. These are usually generated via Google Partner Search (the advertiser portal).

gpsMotivations.description: List of reasons for using Google Partner Search and creating a lead.

minMonthlyBudget.description: The minimum monthly budget lead source is willing to spend.

Money.description: Represents an amount of money with its currency type.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

units.description: The whole units of the amount. For example if `currencyCode` is `"USD"`, then 1 unit is one US dollar.

nanos.description: Number of nano (10^-9) units of the amount. The value must be between -999,999,999 and +999,999,999 inclusive. If `units` is positive, `nanos` must be positive or zero. If `units` is zero, `nanos` can be positive, zero, or negative. If `units` is negative, `nanos` must be negative or zero. For example $-1.75 is represented as `units`=-1 and `nanos`=-750,000,000.

ResponseMetadata.description: Common data that is in each API response.

clientInfo.description: Map of client info, such as URL, browser navigator, browser platform, etc.

Company.description: A company resource in the Google Partners API. Once certified, it qualifies for being searched by advertisers.

localizedInfos.description: The list of localized info for the company.

convertedMinMonthlyBudget.description: The minimum monthly budget that the company accepts for partner business, converted to the requested currency code.

originalMinMonthlyBudget.description: The unconverted minimum monthly budget that the company accepts for partner business.

publicProfile.description: Basic information from the company's public profile.

certificationStatuses.description: The list of Google Partners certification statuses for the company.

ranks.description: Information related to the ranking of the company within the list of companies.

industries.description: Industries the company can help with.

services.description: Services the company can help with.

languageCode.description: Language code of the localized company info, as defined by BCP 47 (IETF BCP 47, "Tags for Identifying Languages").

overview.description: Localized brief description that the company uses to advertise themselves.

countryCodes.description: List of country codes for the localized company info.

Location.description: A location with address and geographic coordinates.

address.description: The complete address of the location.

latLng.description: The latitude and longitude of the location, in degrees.

LatLng.description: An object representing a latitude/longitude pair. This is expressed as a pair of doubles representing degrees latitude and degrees longitude. Unless specified otherwise, this must conform to the WGS84 standard. Values must be within normalized ranges.

latitude.description: The latitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-90.0, +90.0].

longitude.description: The longitude in degrees. It must be in the range [-180.0, +180.0].

PublicProfile.description: Basic information from a public profile.

id.description: The ID which can be used to retrieve more details about the public profile.

displayName.description: The display name of the public profile.

url.description: The URL of the public profile.

displayImageUrl.description: The URL to the main display image of the public profile.

CertificationExamStatus.description: Status for a Google Partners certification exam.

numberUsersPass.description: The number of people who have passed the certification exam.

Rank.description: Information related to ranking of results.

value.description: The numerical value of the rank.

nextPageToken.description: A token to retrieve next page of results. Pass this value in the `ListCompaniesRequest.page_token` field in the subsequent call to [ListCompanies][google.partners.v2.Partner.ListCompanies] to retrieve the next page of results.

lead.description: The lead resource. The `LeadType` must not be `LEAD_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED` and either `email` or `phone_number` must be provided.

id.description: The ID of the reCaptcha challenge.

response.description: The response to the reCaptcha challenge.

CreateLeadResponse.description: Response message for [CreateLead][google.partners.v2.Partner.CreateLead]. Debug information about this request.

lead.description: Lead that was created depending on the outcome of reCaptcha validation.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.name: key
key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.name: oauth_token
oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.
